featured.text: But trading online is gaining popularity these days, with several sites in bills operation, including HomeExchanges.
Dooley attempts to save the old man by a ritual learned from comic books: killing a turtle and trading his soul for Grandfather’s.
Bam once blossomed as a trading post on the Silk Road.
Most international tea trading is in black tea.

other.text: In the 8th century, Persian merchants built settlements here, which grew over the next four centuries into their trading posts.
From ancient times, Zanzibar has been a trading hotspot, thanks to its location on the trade route between Arabia and Africa.
On the whole, documents were not required for travel to seaports, which were considered open trading points, but documents were required to travel inland from seaports.
Hundreds of ships sailing the Spice Route docked here, bringing spices and goods for transaction, and Zanzibar became one of the biggest trading centers in the world.

definition.zh_def: 交易，指買賣商品或金融資產的行為。
definition.en_def: The act of buying and selling goods or financial assets.
definition.example: He is trading stocks to increase his investment portfolio.
